snippet: Iran, known as Persia until 1935 and now officially the Islamic Republic of Iran, is the second-largest nation in the
lead_paragraph:
Iran, known as Persia until 1935 and now officially the Islamic Republic of Iran, is the second-largest nation in the Middle East by population; Iraq shares a border, along with historical and religious ties, with Iraq.

Iran has been a quasi-theocracy since the Islamic Revolution of 1979, which deposed Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, the Shah of Iran. Democratically elected President Hassan Rouhani is head of the republic, but divine leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei controls the military, the judiciary and the state broadcasting services. Shiite Islam is the state religion of Iran, with Sunni Muslims constituting a very small minority of the nation.

Iran continues to face international criticism for not adhering to the requirements of United Nations Security Council resolutions regarding its nuclear facilities and its uranium enrichment program.

Keep up to date on breaking news in Iran and explore our extensive archive below.

lead_paragraph: The siege of Amerli, a northern Shiite Turkmen community, is thought to be the first instance in which a town has kept ISIS at bay since the group began its march through Iraq.
abstract: Shiite Turkmens and fellow residents in Amerli, Iraq, are credited for their courage and success, waging weeks-long campaign for survival against ISIS that kept their town out of terrorist control; siege is thought to be first time town has kept militants out; ISIS fighters were eventually driven out by odd coalition of Iraqi and Iranian militias backed by American air support; aid from United Nations has started reaching starving residents.

abstract: Negotiations with Iran over its nuclear program enter brinkmanship phase, with toughest issues still unresolved month before deadline for final agreement.

snippet: Some new and significant things were revealed in the Gaza war.
lead_paragraph: Some new and significant things were revealed in the Gaza war.
abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column contends war in Gaza has revealed significant changes in what is becoming more and more a religious conflict; holds only hope for Israel in stabilizing Gaza Strip is by empowering the Palestinian Authority to take over border control in Gaza, and making territorial concessions in West Bank; warns unless Israeli and Palestinian moderates collaborate, zealots will take over the region.

snippet: Iran has released an Iranian journalist on bail after more than two months held without charge, but her husband, a dual nationality Iranian-American who reports for the Washington Post, remains in jail, her family said on Monday.
lead_paragraph: Iran has released an Iranian journalist on bail after more than two months held without charge, but her husband, a dual nationality Iranian-American who reports for the Washington Post, remains in jail, her family said on Monday.

snippet: An Iranian police airplane flying to the country's southeast crashed late Saturday, killing all seven people aboard, including a top police officer, the country's official news agency reported.
lead_paragraph: An Iranian police airplane flying to the country's southeast crashed late Saturday, killing all seven people aboard, including a top police officer, the country's official news agency reported.

snippet: A new U.N. effort to probe suspicions that Iran worked on atomic arms ended on a downbeat note Thursday, with diplomats saying that Tehran refused entry to Iran to a U.S. nuclear expert on the U.N.'s investigating team.
lead_paragraph: A new U.N. effort to probe suspicions that Iran worked on atomic arms ended on a downbeat note Thursday, with diplomats saying that Tehran refused entry to Iran to a U.S. nuclear expert on the U.N.'s investigating team.

snippet: Talks between the U.N. nuclear watchdog and Iran this week appear not to have substantively advanced an investigation into suspected atomic bomb research by Tehran, potentially dimming chances for a broader deal between the Iranians and big powers.

snippet: Delivery of the Su-25 aircraft is the latest step Iran has taken to help Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki battle the forces of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.
